4463715/4374042/4463746.title: A Cure for a Cough
4463715/4374042/4463746.text: A cough can be cured in the following way:-    Get a piece of a swede turnip and make small slices of it.    Then put the slices in a saucer, shake a grain of sugar on them and cover them by means of another saucer or deep plate and lave there for a few hours.Then take out the slices and drink a tea-spoonful of the juice before your breakfast for fifteen mornings in succession.    This cured a severe cough which I had a few weeks ago.

4463715/4374047/4463750.title: A Cure for a Cough
4463715/4374047/4463750.text: Get some mountain sedge and put it into a pot or an oven and boil it.   Then let it cool and strain the juice and put it into a bottle and leave it there for a few days before using.   Shake the bottle well and take a wine glassful of it every morning before your breakfast for fifteen mornings. This cure was tried by Miss Celia Joyce who had a severe cough and she found it very successful.

4463715/4374048/4463752.title: A Cure for a Cough
4463715/4374048/4463752.text: A cough may be cured in the following way:-Get three raw eggs, break them and separate the yolk from the white.   Then get a bowl and pour the white of the eggs into it and mix with a spoon for about ten minutes or so.   When you have  that done put about as much sugar as you would think would sweeten it when mixed up and leave it there for a night.   Then take a little drop of it every morning for about a week.    This should banish the cough.

4463715/4374053/4463767.title: A Cure for a Cough
4463715/4374053/4463767.text: Pull about a half pound of mountain-sedge from the roots and boil it.    Next strain it and put the juice into a bottle.Then take a glass of it every morning for about a fortnight.My Grandmother had a cough two years ago and this cured her.

To use it one of its leaves - almost 1/6" thick - was taken and broken; the raw edge was then held close to the eye and the "juice" pressed out; this moisture squirted into the eye with the sharp biting sting of an acid, causing the eye to water copiously. It was considered a very effective remedy.*House Leek?

When a person has a cold and a cough it can be cured easily. First to get a saucepan and to fill it with buttermilk and to boil it. The butter milk is to be left boiling for an hour. After a while the milk breaks and there is whey and curds left. The curds are taken from the whey and they are let cool. The whey is drank a little hot and the curds are eaten afterwards. Sometimes the curds are not eaten but given to the chickens. The whey is the best thing that will take the cold of you.
